New Records: Merih Demiral scored the fastest ever goal in a European Championship knockout match.
Key Match Events: Merih Demiral scored after 57 seconds and then added another with a powerful header just before the hour mark.
Michael Gregoritsch scored for Austria in the 66th minute.
Christoph Baumgartner's header was kept out by a stunning one-handed save from Gunok in the final seconds.
Post-Match Reflections: Turkey coach Vincenzo Montella emphasized the importance of team spirit from the first minute to the last minute.
Vincenzo Montella highlighted the historic nature of the result, matching Turkey's 2008 victories.
Austria's coach Ralf Rangnick reflected on the team's efforts and the lack of necessary luck, comparing Gunok's save to Gordon Banks' famous stop.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Celebrations broke out across many cities in Germany as thousands of Turks took to the streets, honking car horns, waving flags and chanting.
The match was played amid pouring rain.
